text:
Been doing it ever since they discovered the effects of the strakes in the diffusers. It's well known, ruining the racing, yet the FIA simply do nothing about it. One simple rule reg, i.e. no strakes, and the racing would be seriously improved.

Go watch some 80's F1 when they had serious diffusers, but no strakes and watch how they go around corners nose to tail. 

Watch this and see what shit we have today, and why us 'old guys' complain about the shit today ...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R_KGmHzpKU0&t=299s

author: WakandaForeva

text:
Obviously, I was joking, but given the sophistication of Formula 1 today it makes sense. The lighter the car, the faster it can go in relation to other  equally powered engines.

Making his cars lighter was what Colin Chapman was always after. That less weight made his cars less, shall we say, safe has been argued. However, no one knows what caused Jimmy Clark's Formula 2 Lotus to go off the track at Hockenheim on April 7, 1968 and Jochin Rindt's fatal crash at Monza in practice on Sept. 6, 1970 was attributed to brake failure and a badly mounted Armco barrier. Alan Henry's Rindt profile in Autocourse also states that Rindt was driving with no front wings per Chapman to find more speed and his six point harness was not connected .

author: ReclusiveDuck

text:
Rory Coles, get some facts straight.

Ferrari did have a "second wind" (sic), but only in qualifying (indicating a one off overheating). What they were doing with the double batteries still is a mystery, but even though the cars were completely legal, the FIA took it from them anyway. The politicising of it by Toto and Hamilton ("tricks" in every interview) was childish, however it worked for them by embarrassing the FIA into action.

Benz were the first to burn oil, a complete cheat bypassing the very strict fuel flow regulations (FIndia and HAAS both banned in Canada for exceeding the fuel flow), that they weren't stopped after a couple of teams complained, forced other teams to do it as well. Benz should have had their known race results with the known cheat taken away from them. And it was a hands down cheat, not clever, not innovative, just a dirty cheat. 

And how many races did the blown wheel bullshit go on for ...

I would 100% agree there have been periods of time in F1 where teams have been favoured, Ferrari and Renault come immediately to mind, it is now Benz who are clearly being favoured, it's just a fact, and on a far bigger scale than most realise, and it's driving privateers like Williams, out
author: Mark Mark

text: ReclusiveFuck, how about this - the Ferrari was in fact a bit slower and Vettle, had to constantly, and frustratingly, drive the tits off of it, hence the mistakes. Verified by most of Kimi's relative slower performances.
author: Mark Mark

text: @Mark Mark "Kimi's relative slower performances"......Really? How about this? Look at the evidence of Kimi vs Vettel since Vettel joined Ferrari in 2015. In races where BOTH drivers finished in 2015 Kimi only beat Vettel 3 times. In 2016 the same, in 2017 it went down to just 2 races yet in 2018 that shot up to 6 races. How about this? Kimi's podiums in that same period, 2015 Kimi had 3 podiums, 2016 it went up to 4 podiums, 2017 he got 7 podiums and 2018 he got 12 podiums, which equalled Vettel's total podiums for 2018 yet Kimi had 4 retirements compared to Vettel who only had 1. How about this? Vettel underperformed in 2018. Still think it's verified by Kimi's "slower" performances?
author: ReclusiveDuck

text: Fucking butthurt Ferrari fanboy. How have Mercedes killed the sport? No one's killed the sport, but if anyone has, it's all the other teams for being shit. F1 has always had dominance. Vettel with Redbull, Schumacher with Ferrari, etc. - Mercedes were only dominate for 3 years and Hamilton was never a dominate driver - Rosberg always pushed him and actually beat him one year unlike Vettel and Scumacher who just cruised for the wins, because their teammates were number 2 drivers and had to let them win. Also, all teams are constantly analysing each other to see if they're doing anything illegal or there's anything worth copying.
